"Thaikkudam Bridge published an Instagram post, accusing the creators of Varaha Roopam of plaigarism; the dispute officially becomes public and precedes takedowns."
"Kerala High Court orders Hombale Films to stop using 'Varaha Roopam' in theatres and on streaming platforms unless permission obtained from Thaikuddam Bridge."
"Official Varaha Roopam video is removed from YouTube following an injunction."
"During Kantara's digital release on APV, the original song was replaced by a revised tune due to a court order; fans generally had a negative reaction to the change."
"Original song is restored to digital platforms, citing a lack of jurisdiction."
"Kerala High Court dismisses case, after both parties reach a private settlement; original version is reinstated permanently. "

"Release of 'O Sajna' on Spotify.
"Official music video upload on T-Series (Music Label) YT page.

Media reports that Falguni Phatak is trying to pursue legal action against T-Series for copyright infringement, citing that proper licensing was not obtained to sample the original track 'O Sajna'. However, she later clarifies that no legal action will be taken, since she doesn't have the rights to the original track.
"Release of Tamil song 'Kalyana Vayaasu' on Spotify.
"Official music video upload on Zee Music South.
Media reports that fans found similarities in beats/tune between 'Kalyana Vayasu' and Sanan's 'Don't Lie'; Anirudh responds, arguing that he did get the proper licensing to sample the track.
Song was removed from multiple digital platforms including Spotify and YT, citing DRM/copyright issues.
Song re-released on Youtube under Abhay Jodpurkar's voice in December 2018.
Composer Anirudh's version is removed from YouTube once again.
Composer Anirudh's version is removed from Spotify once again.
Release of Bulleya (Ae Dil Hai Mushkil) on Spotify.
Official video release of Bulleya on through the Sony Music India YT page.
Added to Spotify's Editorial Playlists for the first time.

India Today report comes out with suspicion that Bulleya may be a rip-off, due to the similarity in the opening guitar riff between 'Last Resort' and the former; however, not much of a controversy takes place.

News report of Kesariya sharing the same melody within it's chorus as Laree Chootee (2007).

AR Rahman writes in an article that he sought the permission of the families to use the late singer's voice, and accordingly compensated them through royalties for it.
